wikipedia_page.main: Emma Sandys (born Mary Ann Emma Sands) (1843 – November 1877) was a 19th-century British Pre-Raphaelite painter.

response: In the second half of the century, Emma Sandys, Marie Spartali Stillman, Eleanor Fortescue-Brickdale, and Maria ZambacoMaria Zambaco Retrieved June 15, 2010 were women artists of the Pre-Raphaelite movement. Also influenced by the Pre-Raphaelites were Evelyn De Morgan and the activist and painter Barbara Bodichon.
Sandys influenced his younger sister, Emma Sandys (1843–1877), whose works were mainly portraits of children and of young women, often in period or medieval clothing.
